skill.name: documentation
skill.description: Use this skill whenever writing any document - plans, proposals, docs, documentation, brainstorm docs, notes, guides, specs, designs, READMEs, or any markdown file output.
skill.summary: Use this skill whenever writing any document - plans, proposals, docs, documentation, brainstorm doc...
skill.author: BfdCampos

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation guidelines. No code execution, no file access beyond standard AI capabilities, no network calls, and no external commands. Static findings are false positives - the analyzer misidentified documentation-related text as cryptographic references and markdown backticks as shell execution. This is a set of best practices for writing documentation.

content.value_statement: Documentation often ends up unstructured and hard to read. This skill provides clear guidelines for creating well-organized markdown files with proper structure, formatting, and visual hierarchy.
actual_capabilities: Creates well-structured markdown documents with headers and sections
Uses formatting like bold, code blocks, and lists for readability
Suggests diagrams using mermaid syntax when visual aids help
Adapts tone to match document purpose (technical, proposal, brainstorm, plan)
Writes output directly to files instead of terminal dumps
Applies consistent naming conventions for document files
limitations: Does not generate content on its own - needs user prompts to create documents
Does not edit or update existing documents automatically
Does not provide templates for specific document types
Does not validate or check existing documentation

use_cases.title: Create technical documentation
use_cases.description: Write clear READMEs, API docs, and technical guides with proper structure

use_cases.title: Draft project plans
use_cases.description: Create actionable plans and proposals with concrete steps and logical flow

use_cases.title: Structure long-form content
use_cases.description: Organise brainstorm notes, guides, and specs with headers and visual hierarchy

prompt_templates.title: Write a README
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a README for my project in PROJECT/README.md. Include sections for overview, installation, usage, and contributing.

prompt_templates.title: Create API documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create API documentation in docs/api.md. Document the main endpoints, request/response formats, and authentication.

prompt_templates.title: Draft a proposal
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a project proposal in proposals/feature-x.md. Include problem statement, proposed solution, timeline, and expected outcomes.

prompt_templates.title: Make architecture docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Create architecture documentation in docs/architecture.md. Include system overview, component diagram, data flow, and design decisions.

best_practices: Always write to a file instead of dumping content in the terminal
Use headers to create clear structure and navigation
Break up text with lists, tables, and code blocks for readability
anti_patterns: Dumping long-form content directly to the terminal without a file
Ignoring document purpose when choosing tone and structure
Using walls of text without formatting or visual hierarchy

faq.question: Does this skill create documents automatically?
faq.answer: No. You provide the content prompts and this skill helps structure the output correctly into markdown files.

faq.question: What file types does this skill support?
faq.answer: Primarily markdown (.md) files. The guidelines work for any text-based documentation format.

faq.question: Can I use this with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Combine with the mermaid skill for diagrams, and any coding skill for technical content.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution or external network access.

faq.question: Why should I write to files instead of the terminal?
faq.answer: Files preserve formatting, enable version control, and make documentation easy to share and maintain.

faq.question: How is this different from writing without the skill?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidelines that result in more consistent, readable, and well-structured documentation.
